question: What are the names of disaster projects starting later than 2022? Return None if no answer is found.
sub_answers: The disaster projects mentioned in the context are related to FEMA funding for projects such as storm drain repairs, guardrail replacement, and emergency warning sirens. The projects aim to address damage caused by events like the Woolsey Fire and improve the city's infrastructure for disaster response. The estimated completion dates for these projects range from Spring 2022 onwards.

The PCH Signal Synchronization System Improvements Project is expected to be advertised for construction bids after final approval in March 2022. The Westward Beach Road Shoulder Repairs project design is anticipated to be completed by July 2022, with construction beginning in Fall 2022. The Bluffs Park Shade Structure project is scheduled to begin construction in Fall 2022.
final_answer: The disaster projects starting later than 2022 include the PCH Signal Synchronization System Improvements Project, the Westward Beach Road Shoulder Repairs project, and the Bluffs Park Shade Structure project. These projects are part of FEMA funding initiatives aimed at enhancing the city's infrastructure for disaster response. The PCH Signal Synchronization System Improvements Project is set to be advertised for construction bids after final approval in March 2022. The Westward Beach Road Shoulder Repairs project design is expected to be completed by July 2022, with construction commencing in Fall 2022. Additionally, the Bluffs Park Shade Structure project is scheduled to start construction in Fall 2022.

(cid:190) Project Description: This project will be funded through a grant from FEMA
after the Woolsey Fire. The City will create a complete inventory of storm
drains, culverts, debris basins, manholes, and other drainage structures
within the City.

(cid:190) Updates: Council approved an agreement in December for design services.

A kick-off meeting was held in late December.

Guardrail Replacement Citywide (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing the damaged

guardrail throughout the City as a result of the Woolsey Fire.

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consisted of replacing fire damaged existing

Outdoor Warningn Sirens - Design (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: An Emergency Warning Siren system will improve the
City’s ability to alert the community by providing mechanisms to alert
residents in areas without power and those who live in neighborhoods with
poor cell service. Phase One of the project included a sound study to
determine the optimal number and locations of individual sirens, power and
infrastructure requirements, and siren sound range. The City has been

Page 7 of 8

Agenda Item # 4.A.







awarded a FEMA Hazard Mitigation grant to fund the design, engineering and
environmental compliance needed for a shovel ready project. Phase Two of
the Emergency Warning Sirens project will be implementation of the design
plan, including purchasing, installing, and testing the sirens. The City will
apply for future grant funding for this phase of the project.

sq0t3

Clover Heights Storm Drain (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of design and construction of a few
storm drains on Clover Heights. The existing storm drain facility ends at the
intersection of Clover Heights and Harvester Road. During storms, this
intersection floods and causes debris to block the road. An extended storm
drain towards the end of Clover Heights will help eliminate this issue.

(cid:190) Updates:

(cid:131) Staff is currently preparing consultant proposals for the design of this

project. Proposals will be due in February/March.

Latigo Canyon Road Culvert Repairs (FEMA Project)

(cid:190) Project Description: This project consists of repairing the existing storm drain
on Latigo Canyon Road located approximately 2,500 feet from PCH that was
damaged by the Woolsey Fire.
